e4: Changing to the new policy promotes ethical reporting and transparency, reducing potential legal liabilities. It aligns with honest communication, fostering long-term trust with investors. While there may be short-term misunderstandings, investor education can mitigate confusion, ultimately benefiting both stock valuation and investor confidence in the company's integrity.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes accuracy, transparency, and accountability, providing clear and honest information without intentional bias or misrepresentation. It ensures all stakeholders—retail and institutional investors alike—have equal access to understandable data. The policy should also consider legal standards and foster trust, enhancing long-term organizational reputation.
